intro: Pelea pickeringii, commonly known as the Pickering's pelea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are usually small and yellow, contributing to its ecological role in pollination.
